name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and loss of innocence in the American South, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch as her father defends a black man falsely accused of rape.

name: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy adventure following Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship as they journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron in Middle-earth.

name: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: An intimate biographical portrait revealing the untold stories and personal struggles behind one of history's most enigmatic figures, based on extensive interviews with Jobs himself.

name: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: A sweeping science fiction epic set on the desert planet Arrakis, where young Paul Atreides must master ancient powers to prevent an apocalyptic war and fulfill his destiny.

name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A haunting mystery set in Sweden where journalist Mikael Blomkvist teams up with the enigmatic hacker Lisbeth Salander to solve a decades-old disappearance.

name: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: Orwell's powerful allegorical tale of farm animals who rebel against their human farmer, hoping to create an equal society, but find their revolution betrayed by tyranny and corruption.

name: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: A thrilling science fiction survival story about astronaut Mark Watney who must use his ingenuity to survive alone on Mars after being left behind by his crew.

name: The Interpreters
author: Wole Soyinka
description: Soyinka's complex debut novel following a group of young Nigerian intellectuals navigating post-independence disillusionment, corruption, and the search for authentic African identity.

name: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: Murakami's tender coming-of-age story set in 1960s Tokyo, exploring love, loss, and mental illness through the experiences of Toru Watanabe and his relationships with two very different women.

name: Season of Anomy
author: Wole Soyinka
description: A powerful novel set during Nigeria's civil war period, blending mythology with political reality as the protagonist searches for his lost love amidst social upheaval and violence.

name: Ak√©: The Years of Childhood
author: Wole Soyinka
description: Soyinka's luminous autobiography recounting his childhood in colonial Nigeria, capturing the rich cultural traditions of Yoruba society and his early encounters with Western education.

name: The Lion and the Jewel
author: Wole Soyinka
description: A vibrant comedy exploring the clash between tradition and modernity in a Yoruba village, where the village belle must choose between an old chief and a young schoolteacher.

name: Death and the King's Horseman
author: Wole Soyinka
description: Soyinka's masterful tragedy based on real events, exploring the collision between Yoruba tradition and British colonial authority when a ritual suicide is interrupted by government intervention.

name: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: Morrison's Pulitzer Prize-winning masterpiece about Sethe, an escaped slave haunted by the ghost of her deceased daughter, exploring the lasting trauma of slavery on individuals and families.

author: George Orwell
description: Orwell's dystopian masterpiece depicting a totalitarian society where Big Brother watches everything and the protagonist Winston Smith struggles against oppressive surveillance and thought control.

name: Song of Solomon
author: Toni Morrison
description: Morrison's rich allegorical novel following Milkman Dead's journey of self-discovery, weaving together African-American folklore, family history, and the search for identity and belonging.

name: Foundation
author: Isaac Asimov
description: An epic space opera chronicling the fall and rise of galactic civilization, as mathematician Hari Seldon develops psychohistory to predict and guide humanity's future among the stars.

name: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
description: Murakami's surreal tale interweaving the stories of a teenage runaway and an elderly man who can talk to cats, blending reality with magic in contemporary Japan.

name: The Bluest Eye
author: Toni Morrison
description: Morrison's devastating debut novel about a young African-American girl who dreams of having blue eyes, exploring themes of beauty, race, and self-worth in 1940s Ohio.

name: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
description: Murakami's complex novel following Toru Okada's search for his missing cat and wife, leading him into a labyrinthine world of dreams, memories, and mysterious characters.

name: Jazz
author: Toni Morrison
description: Morrison's lyrical novel set in 1920s Harlem, exploring love, betrayal, and redemption through the interconnected lives of Joe, Violet, and Dorcas against the backdrop of the Jazz Age.

name: Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
author: Haruki Murakami
description: Murakami's dual narrative masterpiece alternating between a cyberpunk Tokyo and a dreamlike walled town, exploring consciousness, memory, and the nature of reality.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A classic coming-of-age novel following teenager Holden Caulfield's journey through New York City, exploring themes of alienation, identity, and the loss of innocence.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A charming fantasy adventure following Bilbo Baggins as he joins a company of dwarves on an unexpected journey to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

name: The last summer of reason
author: Wole Soyinka
description: A powerful drama exploring the tensions between tradition and progress in a rural Nigerian community, as environmental changes threaten an ancient way of life.

name: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: A fascinating biography exploring the story of Henrietta Lacks, whose cells were taken without her knowledge and became one of the most important tools in medical research.

name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A masterpiece of American literature exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream through the tragic story of Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

name: Contact
author: Carl Sagan
description: A thought-provoking science fiction novel about humanity's first contact with extraterrestrial intelligence, exploring themes of science, faith, and what it means to be human.

name: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller about the disappearance of Amy Dunne and the subsequent investigation that reveals the dark secrets of her marriage to Nick Dunne.

name: The Road to Wigan Pier
author: George Orwell
description: Orwell's investigation into the living conditions of working-class miners in northern England, combined with his reflections on socialism and class consciousness in 1930s Britain.
